titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to protect cultural and linguistic rights.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 4/7/1987--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Recognizes the right of people to preserve, foster, and promote their historic, linguistic, and cultural origins. States that no person shall be denied the equal protection of the laws because of culture or language.
